084/**
085 *  Library of utility methods that are useful when dealing with Strings. <br>
086 *  <br>Parts of the code were adopted from the class
087 *  <code>org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils</code> and modified to match the
088 *  requirements of this project. In particular, these are the methods
089 *  <ul>
090 *  <li>{@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int) abbreviate()}</li>
091 *  <li>{@link #capitalize(CharSequence) capitalize()}</li>
092 *  <li>{@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence) escapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
093 *  <li>{@link #isEmpty(CharSequence) isEmpty()}</li>
094 *  <li>{@link #isNotEmpty(CharSequence) isNotEmpty()}</li>
095 *  <li>{@link #repeat(CharSequence, int) repeat()}</li>
096 *  <li>{@link #uncapitalize(CharSequence) uncapitalize()}</li>
097 *  <li>{@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence) unescapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
098 *  </ul>
099 *
100 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
101 *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1021 2022-03-01 22:53:02Z tquadrat $
102 *  @since 0.0.3
103 *
104 *  @UMLGraph.link
105 */
106@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
107@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1021 2022-03-01 22:53:02Z tquadrat $" )
108@UtilityClass
109public final class StringUtils
110{
111        /*---------------*\
112    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
113        \*---------------*/
114    /**
115     *  The clipping mode that is used for the method
116     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
117     *
118     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
119     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1021 2022-03-01 22:53:02Z tquadrat $
120     *  @since 0.0.3
121     *
122     *  @UMLGraph.link
123     */
124    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
125    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1021 2022-03-01 22:53:02Z tquadrat $" )
126    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
127    public static enum Clipping
128    {
129            /*------------------*\
130        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
131            \*------------------*/
132        /**
133         *  If an input String is already longer than the target length, it
134         *  will be returned unchanged.
135         */
136        CLIPPING_NONE
137        {
138            /**
139             *  {@inheritDoc}
140             */
141            @Override
142            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return s.toString(); }
143        },
144
145        /**
146         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
147         *  just shortened to that length.
148         */
149        CLIPPING_CUT
150        {
151            /**
152             *  {@inheritDoc}
153             */
154            @Override
155            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length )
156            {
157                final var retValue = (s.length() > length ? s.subSequence( 0, length ) : s).toString();
158
159                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
160                return retValue;
161            }   //  clip()
162        },
163
164        /**
165         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
166         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
167         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}
168         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 4.
169         */
170        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE
171        {
172            /**
173             *  {@inheritDoc}
174             */
175            @Override
176            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return abbreviate( s, length ); }
177        },
178
179        /**
180         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
181         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
182         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviateMiddle(CharSequence, int)}
183         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 5.
184         */
185        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
186        {
187            /**
188             *  {@inheritDoc}
189             */
190            @Override
191            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return abbreviateMiddle( s, length ); }
192        };
193
194            /*---------*\
195        ====** Methods **======================================================
196            \*---------*/
197        /**
198         *  Clips the given input String.
199         *
200         *  @param  s   The input String.
201         *  @param  length  The target length.
202         *  @return The result String.
203         */
204        protected abstract String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length );
205    }
206    //  enum Clipping
207
208    /**
209     *  The padding mode that is used for the methods
210     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,boolean)}
211     *  and
212     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
213     *
214     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
215     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 1021 2022-03-01 22:53:02Z tquadrat $
216     *  @since 0.0.5
217     *
218     *  @UMLGraph.link
219     */
220    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
221    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 1021 2022-03-01 22:53:02Z tquadrat $" )
222    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
223    public static enum Padding
224    {
225            /*------------------*\
226        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
227            \*------------------*/
228        /**
229         *  The pad characters are distributed evenly at begin and end of the
230         *  string.
231         */
232        PADDING_CENTER
233        {
234            /**
235             *  {@inheritDoc}
236             */
237            @Override
238            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
239            {
240                final var rightSize = padSize / 2;
241                final var leftSize = padSize - rightSize;
242                final var retValue = padding( leftSize, c ) + s.toString() + padding( rightSize, c );
243
244                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
245                return retValue;
246            }   //  pad()
247        },
248
249        /**
250         *  The pad characters are added at the beginning of the string
251         *  (prefixing it).
252         */
253        PADDING_LEFT
254        {
255            /**
256             *  {@inheritDoc}
257             */
258            @Override
259            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
260            {
261                return padding( padSize, c ) + s.toString();
262            }   //  pad()
263        },
264
265        /**
266         *  The pad characters are added the end of the string (as a suffix).
267         */
268        PADDING_RIGHT
269        {
270            /**
271             *  {@inheritDoc}
272             */
273            @Override
274            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
275            {
276                return s.toString() + padding( padSize, c );
277            }   //  pad()
278        };
279
280            /*---------*\
281        ====** Methods **======================================================
282            \*---------*/
283        /**
284         *  Pads the given input String.
285         *
286         *  @param  s   The input String.
287         *  @param  padSize The pad size.
288         *  @param  c   The pad character.
289         *  @return The result String.
290         */
291        protected abstract String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c );
292
293        /**
294         *  Returns padding using the specified pad character repeated to the
295         *  given length.<br>
296         *  <br><code>
297         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;0,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
298         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;3,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"eee"<br>
299         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;-2,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;IndexOutOfBoundsException<br>
300         *  </code>
301         *
302         *  @param  repeat  Number of times to repeat {@code padChar}; must be
303         *      0 or greater.
304         *  @param  padChar Character to repeat.
305         *  @return String with repeated {@code padChar} character, or the
306         *      empty String if {@code repeat} is 0.
307         *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {@code repeat} is less than 0.
308         *
309         *  @see StringUtils#repeat(int,int)
310         */
311        private static String padding( final int repeat, final char padChar ) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
312        {
313            if( repeat < 0 ) throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException( format( MSG_PadNegative, repeat ) );
314
315            final var retValue = Character.toString( padChar ).repeat( repeat ).intern();
316
317            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
318            return retValue;
319        }   //  padding()
320    }
321    //  enum Padding
322
323        /*-----------*\
324    ====** Constants **========================================================
325        \*-----------*/
326    /**
327     *  <p>{@summary The regular expression for an HTML or XML comment:
328     *  {@value}.}</p>
329     *  <p>This pattern is used by the
330     *  {@link #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)}
331     *  method.</p>
332     *
333     *  @since 0.0.5
334     */
335    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
336    public static final String COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN = "<!--.+?-->";
337
338    /**
339     *  The initial buffer size that is used by
340     *  {@link #format(String, Object...)}
341     *  and
342     *  {@link #format(Locale, String, Object...)}
343     *  (per thread): {@value}.
344     *
345     *  @since 0.0.5
346     */
347    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
348    public static final int FORMAT_INITIAL_BUFFERSIZE = 2048;
349
350    /**
351     *  The message text indicating that the given value for the abbreviation
352     *  target length is too short.
353     */
354    private static final String MSG_AbbrTooShort = "The minimum abbreviation width is %d";
355
356    /**
357     *  The message indicating that the give size for padding is negative.
358     */
359    private static final String MSG_PadNegative = "Cannot pad a negative amount: %d";
360
361    /**
362     *  The maximum size to which the padding constant(s) can expand: {@value}.
363     *
364     *  @see #repeat(CharSequence,int) repeat() for String
365     *  @see #repeat(char,int) repeat() for char
366     */
367    @SuppressWarnings( "unused" )
368    private static final int PAD_LIMIT = 8192;
369
370    /**
371     *  The regular expression for an HTML or XML tag: {@value}.<br>
372     *  <br>This pattern is used by the
373     *  {@link #stripTags(CharSequence)}
374     *  method.<br>
375     *  <br>As HTML/XML comments may contain a &quot;greater than&quot; sign
376     *  ('&gt;' or '&amp;gt;'), it is necessary to treat comments
377     *  separately.<br>
378     *  <br>Just as a reminder: several sources recommend using the following
379     *  idiom for embedded JavaScript:<pre><code>  &lt;script&gt;
380     *  &lt;!--
381     *  <i>JavaScript code </i>
382     *  --&gt;
383     *  &lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>
384     *
385     *  @since 0.0.5
386     */
387    @SuppressWarnings( "RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup" )
388    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
389    public static final String TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN = "(?:<!--.+?-->)|(?:<[^>]+?>)";
390
391    /**
392     *  The regular expression to identify a variable in a char sequence:
393     *  {@value}.
394     *
395     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
396     *  @see #isValidVariableName(CharSequence)
397     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence,Map...)
398     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Function)
399     *
400     *  @since 0.0.5
401     *  @deprecated Use
402     *      {@link Template#VARIABLE_PATTERN}
403     *      instead.
404     */
405    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
406    @Deprecated( since ="0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
407    public static final String VARIABLE_PATTERN = Template.VARIABLE_PATTERN;
408
409    /**
410     *  The template for variables: {@value}. The argument is the name of the
411     *  variable itself; after an optional prefix character, it may not contain
412     *  other characters than the letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower
413     *  case), the digits from '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore
414     *  ('_') and dot ('.').<br>
415     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
416     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
417     *  ('&amp;').<br>
418     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
419     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
420     *  special variable.
421     *
422     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
423     *
424     *  @since 0.0.5
425     *  @deprecated Use
426     *      {@link Template#VARIABLE_TEMPLATE}
427     *      instead.
428     */
429    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
430    @Deprecated( since ="0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
431    public static final String VARIABLE_TEMPLATE = Template.VARIABLE_TEMPLATE;
432
433        /*------------------------*\
434    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
435        \*------------------------*/
436    /**
437     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML comment.
438     *
439     *  @see #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)
440     *  @see #COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN
441     */
442    private static final Pattern m_CommentRemovalPattern;
443
444    /**
445     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML tag.
446     *
447     *  @see #stripTags(CharSequence)
448     *  @see #TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN
449     */
450    private static final Pattern m_TagRemovalPattern;
451
452    static
453    {
454        //---* The regex patterns *--------------------------------------------
455        try
456        {
457            m_CommentRemovalPattern = compile( COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
458            m_TagRemovalPattern = compile( TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
459        }
460        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
461        {
462            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "The patterns are constant values that have been tested", e );
463        }
464    }

472    private StringUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( StringUtils.class ); }

474        /*---------*\
475    ====** Methods **==========================================================
476        \*---------*/
477    /**
478     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
479     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
480     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is the time for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
481     *  <br>Specifically:
482     *  <ul>
483     *  <li>If {@code text} is less than {@code maxWidth} characters long,
484     *  return it unchanged.</li>
485     *  <li>Else abbreviate it to <code>(substring( text, 0, max - 1 ) +
486     *  &quot;\u2026&quot; )</code>.</li>
487     *  <li>If {@code maxWidth} is less than 4, throw an
488     *  {@link ValidationException}.</li>
489     *  <li>In no case it will return a String of length greater than
490     *  {@code maxWidth}.</li>
491     *  </ul>
492     *  Some samples:<br>
493     *  <pre><code>
494     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, * )      = null
495     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 4 )        = ""
496     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abc", 4 ) = "abc"
497     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcd", 4 ) = "abcd;"
498     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 4 ) = "abc&hellip;"
499     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 7 ) = "abcdefg"
500     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 8 ) = "abcdefg"
501     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 3 ) = IllegalArgumentException
502     *  </code></pre>
503     *
504     *  @param  text    The String to abbreviate, can be {@code null}.
505     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
506     *      least 4.
507     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
508     *      already {@code null}.
509     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
510     *      than 4.
511     *
512     *  @since 0.0.5
513     */
514    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
515    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
516    {
517        return abbreviate( text, 0, maxWidth );
518    }   //  abbreviate()
519
520    /**
521     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
522     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
523     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>&hellip;is the time
524     *  for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
525     *  <br>Works like
526     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)},
527     *  but allows to specify a &quot;left edge&quot; offset. Note that this
528     *  left edge is not necessarily going to be the leftmost character in the
529     *  result, or the first character following the ellipses, but it will
530     *  appear somewhere in the result. An offset less than 0 will be treated
531     *  as 0, a value greater than {@code maxWidth} will be ignored.<br>
532     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
533     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
534     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
535     *  <pre>
536     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, *, * )                = null
537     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 0, 4 )                  = ""
538     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", -1, 10 ) = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
539     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 0, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
540     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 1, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
541     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 4, 10 )  = "&hellip;efghijkl&hellip;"
542     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 5, 10 )  = "&hellip;fghijklm&hellip;"
543     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 6, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
544     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 8, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
545     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 10, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
546     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 12, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
547     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 0, 3 )        = IllegalArgumentException
548     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 5, 6 )        = IllegalArgumentException
549     *  </pre>
550     *
551     *  @param  text    The String to process, can be {@code null}.
552     *  @param  offset  The left edge of the source String; this value will not
553     *      be checked.
554     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
555     *      least 4.
556     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
557     *      already {@code null}.
558     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
559     *      than 4.
560     *
561     *  @since 0.0.5
562     */
563    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
564    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int offset, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
565    {
566        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
567
568        String retValue = null;
569        if( nonNull( text ) )
570        {
571            if( maxWidth < 4 ) throw new ValidationException( format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 4 ) );
572
573            final var len = text.length();
574            if( len > maxWidth )
575            {
576                var effectiveOffset = min( offset, len);
577                if( (len - effectiveOffset) < (maxWidth - 1))
578                {
579                    effectiveOffset = len - (maxWidth - 1);
580                }
581                if( effectiveOffset <= 1 )
582                {
583                    retValue = text.subSequence( 0, maxWidth - 1 ) + ellipsis;
584                }
585                else
586                {
587                    if( ((effectiveOffset + maxWidth) - 1) < len )
588                    {
589                        retValue = ellipsis + abbreviate( text.subSequence( effectiveOffset, len ), maxWidth - 1 );
590                    }
591                    else
592                    {
593                        retValue = ellipsis + text.subSequence( len - (maxWidth - 1), len );
594                    }
595                }
596            }
597            else
598            {
599                retValue = text.toString();
600            }
601        }
602
603        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
604        return retValue;
605    }   //  abbreviate()
606
607    /**
608     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
609     *  0x2026) in the middle of the returned text. This will turn &quot;<i>Now
610     *  is the time for all good men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is &hellip;
611     *  good men</i>&quot;<br>
612     *  <br>Works like
613     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}.<br>
614     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
615     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
616     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
617     *  <pre>
618     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle(null, *)      = null
619     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("", 5)        = ""
620     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 5) = "ab&hellip;gh"
621     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 7) = "ab&hellip;gh"
622     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 8) = "abcdefgh"
623     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 4) = IllegalArgumentException
624     *  </pre>
625     *
626     *  @param  str The String to check, may be {@code null}.
627     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
628     *      least 5.
629     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
630     *      already {@code null}.
631     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
632     *      than 5.
633     *
634     *  @since 0.0.5
635     */
636    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
637    public static final String abbreviateMiddle( final CharSequence str, final int maxWidth )
638    {
639        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
640
641        String retValue = null;
642        if( nonNull( str ) )
643        {
644            if( maxWidth < 5 ) throw new ValidationException( format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 5 ) );
645
646            final var len = str.length();
647            if( len > maxWidth )
648            {
649                final var suffixLength = (maxWidth - 1) / 2;
650                final var prefixLength = maxWidth - 1 - suffixLength;
651                final var suffixStart = len - suffixLength;
652                retValue = str.subSequence( 0, prefixLength ) + ellipsis + str.subSequence( suffixStart, suffixStart + suffixLength );
653            }
654            else
655            {
656                retValue = str.toString();
657            }
658        }
659
660        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
661        return retValue;
662    }   //  abbreviateMiddle()
663
664    /**
665     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a long string into chunks of the given length.}</p>
666     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
667     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array or a
668     *  collection.</p>
669     *  <p>To array:</p>
670     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
671     *  <p>To collection (here: a
672     *  {@link List}):</p>
673     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
674     *
675     *  @param  s   The string.
676     *  @param  chunk   The chunk size.
677     *  @return The chunks from the string; the last chunk could be shorter
678     *      than the others.
679     *
680     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
681     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
682     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
683     *
684     *  @since 0.0.5
685     */
686    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
687    public static final Stream<String> breakString( final CharSequence s, final int chunk )
688    {
689        if( chunk < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( format( "Chunk size must not be zero or a negative number: %d", chunk ) );
690
691        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
692        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).length();
693        var pos = 0;
694        while( (pos + chunk) < len )
695        {
696            builder.add( s.subSequence( pos, pos + chunk ).toString() );
697            pos += chunk;
698        }
699        if( pos < len ) builder.add( s.subSequence( pos, len ).toString() );
700
701        final var retValue = builder.build();
702
703        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
704        return retValue;
705    }   //  breakString()
706
707    /**
708     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a text into lines of the given length, but
709     *  different from
710     *  {@link #breakString(CharSequence, int)},
711     *  it will honour whitespace.}</p>
712     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
713     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array, a String, or
714     *  a collection.</p>
715     *  <p>To array:</p>
716     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
717     *  <p>To String:</p>
718     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.joining() )</code></pre>
719     *  <p>To collection (here: a
720     *  {@link List}):</p>
721     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
722     *
723     *  @param  text    The text.
724     *  @param  lineLength  The length of a line.
725     *  @return The lines; if a word is longer than the given line length, a
726     *      line containing only that word can be longer that the given line
727     *      length.
728     *
729     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
730     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
731     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
732     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence)
733     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence)
734     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
735     *
736     *  @since 0.0.5
737     */
738    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
739    public static final Stream<String> breakText( final CharSequence text, final int lineLength )
740    {
741        if( lineLength < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( format( "Line length size must not be zero or a negative number: %d", lineLength ) );
742
743        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
744
745        for( final var line : splitString( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ), '\n' ) )
746        {
747            if( isEmptyOrBlank( line ) )
748            {
749                builder.add( EMPTY_STRING );
750            }
751            else
752            {
753                final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
754                final var chunks = line.split( "\\s" );
755                SplitLoop: for( final var c : chunks )
756                {
757                    if( c.isEmpty() ) continue SplitLoop;
758                    if( (buffer.length() + 1 + c.length()) < lineLength )
759                    {
760                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer) ) buffer.append( ' ' );
761                    }
762                    else
763                    {
764                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) )
765                        {
766                            builder.add( buffer.toString() );
767                            buffer.setLength( 0 );
768                        }
769                    }
770                    buffer.append( c );
771                }   //  SplitLoop:
772                if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) ) builder.add( buffer.toString() );
773            }
774        }
775
776        final var retValue = builder.build();
777
778        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
779        return retValue;
780    }   //  breakText()
781
782    /**
783     *  <p>{@summary <i>Capitalises</i> a String, meaning changing the first
784     *  letter to upper case as per
785     *  {@link Character#toUpperCase(char)}.} No other letters are changed.</p>
786     *  <p>A {@code null} input String returns {@code null}.</p>
787     *  <p>Samples:</p>
788     *  <pre><code>  StringUtils.capitalize( null )  == null;
789     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;&quot; )    == &quot;&quot;;
790     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cat&quot; ) == &quot;Cat&quot;;
791     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cAt&quot; ) == &quot;CAt&quot;;</code></pre>
792     *  <p>Use this function to create a getter or setter name from the name of
793     *  the attribute.</p>
794     *  <p>This method does not recognise the
795     *  {@linkplain java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}.
796     *  This means that &quot;istanbul&quot; will become &quot;Istanbul&quot;
797     *  even for the locale {@code tr_TR} (although &quot;&#x130;stanbul&quot;
798     *  would be correct).</p>
799     *
800     *  @param c    The String to capitalise, can be {@code null}.
801     *  @return The capitalised String, or {@code null} if the argument
802     *      was already {@code null}.
803     *
804     *  @see #decapitalize(CharSequence)
805     *
806     *  @since 0.0.5
807     */
808    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
809    public static final String capitalize( final CharSequence c )
810    {
811        String retValue = null;
812        if( nonNull( c ) )
813        {
814            final var s = c.toString();
815            if( s.isEmpty() )
816            {
817                retValue = s;
818            }
819            else
820            {
821                retValue = (toUpperCase( s.charAt( 0 ) ) + s.substring( 1 )).intern();
822            }
823        }
824
825        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
826        return retValue;
827    }   //  capitalize()
828
829    /**
830     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
831     *  longer than the given maximum length.
832     *
833     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
834     *      will be thrown.
835     *  @param  text    The text to check.
836     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
837     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
838     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
839     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
840     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
841     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
842     *      {@code maxLength}.
843     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException {@code text} is the empty String.
844     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
845     *      {@code null}.
846     *
847     *  @deprecated Replaced by
848     *      {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)}
849     */
850    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
851    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
852    public static final String checkText( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
853    {
854        return checkTextLen( name, text, maxLength );
855    }   //  checkText()
856
857    /**
858     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
859     *  longer than the given maximum length. Use this to check whether a
860     *  String that is provided as an argument to a method is longer than
861     *  expected.
862     *
863     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
864     *      will be thrown. Usually this is the name of the argument to
865     *      validate.
866     *  @param  text    The text to check.
867     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
868     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
869     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
870     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
871     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
872     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
873     *      {@code maxLength}.
874     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
875     *      the empty String.
876     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
877     *      {@code null}.
878     *
879     *  @since 0.0.5
880     */
881    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
882    public static final String checkTextLen( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
883    {
884        if( requireNotEmptyArgument( text, requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ) ).length() > maxLength )
885        {
886            throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
887        }
888
889        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
890        return text.toString();
891    }   //  checkTextLen()
892
893    /**
894     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
895     *  different from
896     *  {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)},
897     *  it may be {@code null} or empty.
898     *
899     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
900     *      will be thrown.
901     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
902     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
903     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String, {@code null}
904     *      if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the argument fails any of the
905     *      tests, an
906     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
907     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
908     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
909     *      {@code maxLength}.
910     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is empty.
911     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
912     *
913     *  @since 0.0.5
914     */
915    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
916    public static final String checkTextLenNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException
917    {
918        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
919
920        String retValue = null;
921        if( nonNull( text ) )
922        {
923            if( text.length() > maxLength )
924            {
925                throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
926            }
927            retValue = text.toString();
928        }
929
930        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
931        return retValue;
932    }   //  checkTextLenNull()
933
934    /**
935     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
936     *  it may be {@code null}.
937     *
938     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
939     *      will be thrown.
940     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
941     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
942     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String,
943     *      {@code null} if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the
944     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
945     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
946     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
947     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
948     *      {@code maxLength}.
949     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
950     *
951     *  @deprecated Replaced by
952     *      {@link #checkTextLenNull(String, CharSequence, int)}.
953     */
954    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
955    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
956    public static final String checkTextNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength )
957    {
958        return checkTextLenNull( name, text, maxLength );
959    }   //  checkTextNull()
960
961    /**
962     *  Changes the first letter of the given String tolower case as per
963     *  {@link Character#toLowerCase(char)}.
964     *  No other letters are changed. A {@code null} input String returns
965     *  {@code null}.<br>
966     *  <br>Samples:<pre><code>  StringUtils.decapitalize( null ) = null;
967     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;&quot;)     = &quot;&quot;;
968     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;Cat&quot;)  = &quot;cat&quot;;
969     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;CAT&quot;)  = &quot;cAT&quot;;</code></pre>
970     *  <br>Basically, this is the complementary method to
971     *  {@link #capitalize(CharSequence)}.
972     *  Use this method to normalise the name of bean attributes.
973     *
974     *  @param  s   The String to <i>decapitalise</i>, may be {@code null}.
975     *  @return The <i>decapitalised</i> String, {@code null} if the argument
976     *      was {@code null}.
977     *  @see #capitalize(CharSequence)
978     *
979     *  @since 0.0.5
980     */
981    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
982    public static final String decapitalize( final CharSequence s )
983    {
984        String retValue = null;
985
986        if( nonNull( s ) )
987        {
988            retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
989            if( isNotEmpty( s ) )
990            {
991                final var str = s.toString();
992                retValue = (toLowerCase( str.charAt( 0 ) ) + str.substring( 1 )).intern();
993            }
994        }
995
996        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
997        return retValue;
998    }   //  decapitalize()
999
1000    /**
1001     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the non-ASCII and special characters in a
1002     *  {@code String} so that the result can be used in the context of HTML.}
1003     *  Wherever possible, the method will return the respective HTML&nbsp;5
1004     *  entity; only when there is no matching entity, it will use the Unicode
1005     *  escape.</p>
1006     *  <p>So if you call the method with the argument
1007     *  &quot;<i>S&uuml;&szlig;e</i>&quot;, it will return
1008     *  &quot;<code>S&amp;uuml;&amp;szlig;e</code>&quot;.</p>
1009     *  <p>If the input will be, for example, a Chinese text like this:
1010     *  &quot;<i>çä½</i>&quot; (means "Ball"), you may get back something like
1011     *  this: &quot;<code>&amp;#x7403;&amp;#x4F53;</code>&quot;, as there are
1012     *  no entities defined for (any) Chinese letters.</p>
1013     *  <p>The method supports all known HTML&nbsp;5.0 entities, including
1014     *  funky accents. But it will not escape several commonly used characters
1015     *  like the full stop ('.'), the comma (','), the colon (':'), or the
1016     *  semicolon (';'), although they will be handled properly by
1017     *  {@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)}.</p>
1018     *  <p>Note that the commonly used apostrophe escape character
1019     *  (&amp;apos;) that was not a legal entity for HTML before HTML&nbsp;5 is
1020     *  now supported.</p>
1021     *
1022     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1023     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1024     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1025     *
1026     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
1027     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
1028     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
1029     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
1030     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
1031     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
1032     *
1033     *  @since 0.0.5
1034     */
1035    /*
1036     *  For some unknown reasons, JavaDoc will not accept the entities &#x7403;
1037     *  and &#x4F53; (for 'ç' and 'ä½'), therefore it was required to add the
1038     *  Chinese character directly into the comment above.
1039     */
1040    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1041    public static final String escapeHTML( final CharSequence str )
1042    {
1043        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? HTML50.escape( str ) : null;
1044
1045        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1046        return retValue;
1047    }   //  escapeHTML()
1048
1049    /**
1050     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using HTML entities and
1051     *  writes them to an
1052     *  {@link Appendable}.
1053     *  For details, refer to
1054     *  {@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence)}.
1055     *
1056     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
1057     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1058     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1059     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1060     *      from calls to the
1061     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
1062     *      method.
1063     *
1064     *  @see #escapeHTML(CharSequence)
1065     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
1066     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
1067     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
1068     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
1069     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
1070     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
1071     *
1072     *  @since 0.0.5
1073     */
1074    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1075    public static final void escapeHTML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1076    {
1077        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1078
1079        if( nonNull( str ) ) HTML50.escape( appendable, str );
1080    }   //  escapeHTML()
1081
1082    /**
1083     *  Formats the given {@code String} for the output into JSONText. This
1084     *  means that the input sequence will be surrounded by double quotes, and
1085     *  backslash sequences are put into all the right places.<br>
1086     *  <br>&lt; and &gt; will be inserted as their Unicode values, allowing
1087     *  JSON text to be delivered in HTML.<br>
1088     *  <br>In JSON text, a string cannot contain a control character or an
1089     *  unescaped quote or backslash, so these are translated to Unicode
1090     *  escapes also.
1091     *
1092     *  @param  str The string to escape to the JSON format; it may be empty,
1093     *      but not {@code null}.
1094     *  @return A string correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.
1095     *
1096     *  @since 0.0.5
1097     */
1098    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1099    public static final String escapeJSON( final CharSequence str )
1100    {
1101        var retValue = "\"\""; // The JSON empty string.
1102        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( str, "str" ).length();
1103        if( len > 0 )
1104        {
1105            final var buffer = new StringBuilder( len * 2 ).append( '"' );
1106            char c;
1107            for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
1108            {
1109                c = str.charAt( i );
1110                switch( c )
1111                {
1112                    case '\\':
1113                    case '"':
1114                    case '<':
1115                    case '>':
1116                    case '&':
1117                        buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1118                        break;
1119
1120                    case '\b':
1121                        buffer.append( "\\b" );
1122                        break;
1123
1124                    case '\t':
1125                        buffer.append( "\\t" );
1126                        break;
1127
1128                    case '\n':
1129                        buffer.append( "\\n" );
1130                        break;
1131
1132                    case '\f':
1133                        buffer.append( "\\f" );
1134                        break;
1135
1136                    case '\r':
1137                        buffer.append( "\\r" );
1138                        break;
1139
1140                    default:
1141                        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression
1142                        if( (c < ' ')
1143                            || ((c >= '\u0080') && (c < '\u00a0'))
1144                            || ((c >= '\u2000') && (c < '\u2100')) )
1145                        {
1146                            buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1147                        }
1148                        else
1149                        {
1150                            buffer.append( c );
1151                        }
1152                        break;
1153                }
1154            }
1155            buffer.append( '"' );
1156            retValue = buffer.toString();
1157        }
1158
1159        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1160        return retValue;
1161    }   //  escapeJSON()
1162
1163    /**
1164     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes and writes them to a
1165     *  {@link Appendable}.
1166     *
1167     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1168     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1169     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1170     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1171     *      from calls to the
1172     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1173     *      method.
1174     *
1175     *  @since 0.0.5
1176     */
1177    @SuppressWarnings( "SwitchStatementWithTooManyBranches" )
1178    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1179    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final char c ) throws IOException
1180    {
1181        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1182
1183        TestSwitch: switch( c )
1184        {
1185            case '\\' -> appendable.append( "\\" );
1186            case '[', ']', '{', '}', '(', ')', '^', '$', '&', '*', '.', '+', '|', '?' -> appendable.append( "\\" ).append( c );
1187            case '\t' -> appendable.append( "\\t" );
1188            case '\n' -> appendable.append( "\\n" );
1189            case '\r' -> appendable.append( "\\r" );
1190            case '\f' -> appendable.append( "\\f" );
1191            case '\u0007' -> appendable.append( "\\a" );
1192            case '\u001B' -> appendable.append( "\\e" ); // ESC
1193            default -> appendable.append( c );
1194        }   //  TestSwitch:
1195    }   //  escapeRegex()
1196
1197    /**
1198     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes.
1199     *
1200     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1201     *  @return A {@code String} with the escaped character.
1202     *
1203     *  @since 0.0.5
1204     */
1205    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1206    public static final String escapeRegex( final char c )
1207    {
1208        final var retValue = new StringBuilder();
1209        try
1210        {
1211            escapeRegex( retValue, c );
1212        }
1213        catch( final IOException e )
1214        {
1215            /*
1216             * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1217             * not define an IOException.
1218             */
1219            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1220        }
1221
1222        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1223        return retValue.toString();
1224    }   //  escapeRegex()
1225
1226    /**
1227     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes.
1228     *
1229     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1230     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the argument
1231     *      was already {@code null}.
1232     *
1233     *  @since 0.0.5
1234     */
1235    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1236    public static final String escapeRegex( final CharSequence str )
1237    {
1238        String retValue = null;
1239        if( nonNull( str ) )
1240        {
1241            final var len = str.length();
1242            if( len > 0 )
1243            {
1244                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( (len * 12) / 10 );
1245                try
1246                {
1247                    escapeRegex( buffer, str );
1248                }
1249                catch( final IOException e )
1250                {
1251                    /*
1252                     * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1253                     * not define an IOException.
1254                     */
1255                    throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1256                }
1257                retValue = buffer.toString();
1258            }
1259            else
1260            {
1261                retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
1262            }
1263        }
1264
1265        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1266        return retValue;
1267    }   //  escapeRegex()
1268
1269    /**
1270     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes and
1271     *  writes them to a
1272     *  {@link Appendable}.
1273     *
1274     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1275     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape. If {@code null} or the empty
1276     *      String, nothing will be put to the appendable.
1277     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1278     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1279     *      from calls to the
1280     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1281     *      method.
1282     *
1283     *  @since 0.0.5
1284     */
1285    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1286    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1287    {
1288        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1289
1290        if( isNotEmpty( str ) )
1291        {
1292            ScanLoop: for( var i = 0; i < str.length(); ++i )
1293            {
1294                escapeRegex( appendable, str.charAt( i ) );
1295            }   //  ScanLoop:
1296        }
1297    }   //  escapeRegex()
1298
1299    /**
1300     *  Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the given character. This will
1301     *  return &quot;&#92;u0075&quot; for the letter 'u', and
1302     *  &quot;&#92;u003c&quot; for the smaller-than sign '&lt;'.<br>
1303     *  <br>This method should be used only for characters that are not
1304     *  surrogates; for general use, the implementation that takes a code point
1305     *  is preferred.
1306     *
1307     *  @param  c   The character.
1308     *  @return The escape sequence.
1309     *
1310     *  @see #escapeUnicode(int)
1311     *
1312     *  @since 0.0.5
1313     *  @deprecated Use
1314     *      {@link CharSetUtils#escapeCharacter(char)}
1315     *      instead.
1316     */
1317    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1318    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1319    public static final String escapeUnicode( final char c ) { return escapeCharacter( c ); }
1320
1321    /**
1322     *  Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the given code point. This will
1323     *  return &quot;&#92;u0075&quot; for the letter 'u', and
1324     *  &quot;&#92;u003c&quot; for the smaller-than sign '&lt;'.<br>
1325     *  <br>This method takes only a single code point; to translate a whole
1326     *  String, this code sequence can be used:<pre><code>  &hellip;
1327     *  String result = input.codePoints()
1328     *      .mapToObj( codePoint -&gt; escapeUnicode( codePoint ) )
1329     *      .collect( Collectors.joining() );
1330     *  &hellip;</code></pre>
1331     *  This will escape <i>all</i> characters in the String. If only a subset
1332     *  needs to be escaped, the mapping function in
1333     *  {@link java.util.stream.IntStream#mapToObj(java.util.function.IntFunction) mapToObj()}
1334     *  can be adjusted accordingly. Something like that is implemented with
1335     *  the method
1336     *  {@link #toUnicode(CharSequence)}.
1337     *
1338     *  @param  codePoint   The character.
1339     *  @return The escape sequence.
1340     *
1341     *  @see String#codePoints()
1342     *  @see java.util.stream.IntStream#mapToObj(java.util.function.IntFunction)
1343     *  @see java.util.stream.Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
1344     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
1345     *
1346     *  @since 0.0.5
1347     *  @deprecated Use
1348     *      {@link CharSetUtils#escapeCharacter(int)}
1349     *      instead.
1350     */
1351    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1352    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1353    public static final String escapeUnicode( final int codePoint ) { return escapeCharacter( codePoint ); }
1354
1355    /**
1356     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML
1357     *  entities.}</p>
1358     *  <p>For example:</p>
1359     *  <p>{@code "bread" & "butter"}</p>
1360     *  <p>becomes:</p>
1361     *  <p><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1362     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.</p>
1363     *
1364     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be null.
1365     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1366     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1367     *
1368     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
1369     */
1370    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1371    public static final String escapeXML( final CharSequence str )
1372    {
1373        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? XML.escape( str ) : null;
1374
1375        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1376        return retValue;
1377    }   //  escapeXML()

1379    /**
1380     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML
1381     *  entities and writes them to an
1382     *  {@link Appendable}.}</p>

1386     *  <p><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;

1410    /**
1411     *  Collects all the variables of the form
1412     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the given String.<br>
1413     *  <br>If there are not any variables in the given String, an empty
1414     *  {@link Collection}
1415     *  will be returned.<br>
1416     *  <br>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
1417     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
1418     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
1419     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
1420     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
1421     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
1422     *  ('&amp;').<br>
1423     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
1424     *  special variable.
1425     *
1426     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
1427     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
1428     *
1429     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
1430     *
1431     *  @since 0.0.5
1432     *  @deprecated Use
1433     *      {@link Template#findVariables(CharSequence)}
1434     *      instead.
1435     */
1436    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1437    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1438    public static final Collection<String> findVariables( final CharSequence text )
1439    {
1440        return Template.findVariables( text );
1441    }   //  findVariables()
1442
1443    /**
1444     *  Returns a formatted String using the specified format String and
1445     *  arguments.<br>
1446     *  <br>The implementation uses internally the
1447     *  {@link Locale}
1448     *  that is returned by
1449     *  {@link java.util.Locale#getDefault() Locale.getDefault()}.<br>
1450     *  <br>This method is meant as a replacement for the method
1451     *  {@link java.lang.String#format(String, Object...)};
1452     *  that implementation always uses a new instance of
1453     *  {@link Formatter}
1454     *  for each invocation. The implementation here uses a cached instance
1455     *  instead, and as {@code Formatter} is not inherently thread-safe, this
1456     *  cached instance is created and stored per thread, therefore no
1457     *  synchronisation is needed.<br>
1458     *  <br>This implementation is about as twice as fast as
1459     *  {@code java.lang.String.format()}.
1460     *
1461     *  @param  format  A format String with the syntax as described for the
1462     *      {@link Formatter}
1463     *      class.
1464     *  @param  args    The arguments referenced by the format specifiers in
1465     *      the {@code format} String. If there are more arguments than format
1466     *      specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of
1467     *      arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of
1468     *      arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as
1469     *      defined by <cite>The Java&trade; Virtual Machine
1470     *      Specification</cite>. The behaviour on a {@code null} argument
1471     *      depends on the conversion.
1472     *  @throws IllegalFormatException A format string contains an illegal
1473     *      syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given
1474     *      arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other
1475     *      illegal conditions occurred. For specification of all possible
1476     *      formatting errors, see the &quot;Details&quot; section of the
1477     *      {@code Formatter} class specification.
1478     *  @return A formatted String.
1479     *
1480     *  @see  java.util.Formatter
1481     *
1482     *  @since 0.0.5
1483     */
1484    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1485    public static final String format( final String format, final Object... args ) throws IllegalFormatException
1486    {
1487        return SharedFormatter.format( format, args );
1488    }   //  format()
1489
1490    /**
1491     *  Returns a formatted String using the specified
1492     *  {@link Locale},
1493     *  format String, and arguments.<br>
1494     *  <br>This method is meant as a replacement for the method
1495     *  {@link java.lang.String#format(String, Object...)};
1496     *  that implementation always uses a new instance of
1497     *  {@link Formatter}
1498     *  for each invocation. The implementation here uses a cached instance
1499     *  instead, and as {@code Formatter} is not inherently thread-safe, this
1500     *  cached instance is created and stored per thread, therefore no
1501     *  synchronisation is needed.<br>
1502     *  <br>The performance gain for this implementation is not that impressive
1503     *  when compared with that of
1504     *  {@link #format(String, Object...)},
1505     *  but still in the 10% range.
1506     *  {@code java.lang.String.format()}.
1507     *
1508     *  @param  locale  The
1509     *      {@link Locale}
1510     *      that will be applied during formatting. If {@code locale} is
1511     *      {@code null} then no localisation is applied.
1512     *  @param  format  A format String with the syntax as described for the
1513     *      {@link Formatter}
1514     *      class.
1515     *  @param  args    The arguments referenced by the format specifiers in
1516     *      the {@code format} String. If there are more arguments than format
1517     *      specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of
1518     *      arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of
1519     *      arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as
1520     *      defined by <cite>The Java&trade; Virtual Machine
1521     *      Specification</cite>. The behaviour on a {@code null} argument
1522     *      depends on the conversion.
1523     *  @throws IllegalFormatException A format string contains an illegal
1524     *      syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given
1525     *      arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other
1526     *      illegal conditions occurred. For specification of all possible
1527     *      formatting errors, see the &quot;Details&quot; section of the
1528     *      {@code Formatter} class specification.
1529     *  @return A formatted String.
1530     *
1531     *  @see  java.util.Formatter
1532     *
1533     *  @since 0.0.5
1534     */
1535    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1536    public static final String format( final Locale locale, final String format, final Object... args ) throws IllegalFormatException
1537    {
1538        return SharedFormatter.format( locale, format, args );
1539    }   //  format()
1540

1702    /**
1703     *  Combines the given
1704     *  {@link Collection}
1705     *  of String to a single string, with the given separator.
1706     *
1707     *  @param  s   The input sequence.
1708     *  @param  separator   The separator; may be empty, but not {@code null}.
1709     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence collection is empty,
1710     *      the empty String will be returned.
1711     *
1712     *  @deprecated Use
1713     *      {@link java.lang.String#join(CharSequence,Iterable)}
1714     *      instead.
1715     */
1716    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.4" )
1717    @Deprecated( since = "Java 9", forRemoval = true )
1718    public static final String joinString( final Collection<? extends CharSequence> s, final CharSequence separator )
1719    {
1720        final var retValue = join( requireNonNullArgument( separator, "separator" ), requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ) );
1721
1722        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1723        return retValue;
1724    }   //  joinString()
1725
1726    /**
1727     *  Combines the given
1728     *  {@link Stream}
1729     *  of Strings to a single string, with the given separator.
1730     *
1731     *  @param  s   The input sequence.
1732     *  @param  separator   The separator; may be empty, but not {@code null}.
1733     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence stream is empty,
1734     *      the empty String will be returned.
1735     *
1736     *  @deprecated This method is obsolete; the same effect can be achieved
1737     *      easily by calling
1738     *      {@link Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)}
1739     *      on the stream, with the collector
1740     *      {@link java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence) joining()}
1741     *      as its argument.
1742     */
1743    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.4" )
1744    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )
1745    public static final String joinString( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> s, final CharSequence separator )
1746    {
1747        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).collect( joining( separator ) );
1748
1749        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1750        return retValue;
1751    }   //  joinString()
1752
1753    /**
1754     *  Combines the given String array to a single string, with the given
1755     *  separator.
1756     *
1757     *  @param  s   The input sequence.
1758     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1759     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence array is empty, the
1760     *      empty String will be returned.
1761     *
1762     *  @deprecated This method is obsolete; the same effect can be achieved
1763     *      easily by calling
1764     *      {@link String#join(CharSequence, CharSequence...)}.
1765     */
1766    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )
1767    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.4" )
1768    public static final String joinString( final CharSequence [] s, final char separator )
1769    {
1770        final var retValue = join( Character.toString( separator), requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ) );
1771
1772        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1773        return retValue;
1774    }   //  joinString()

1782     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence collection is empty, the
1783     *      empty String will be returned.
1784     *

1786     *      easily by calling
1787     *      {@link String#join(CharSequence, Iterable)}
1788     */
1789    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )

1791    public static final String joinString( final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> s, final char separator )

1793        final var retValue = join( Character.toString( separator), requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ) );
1794
1795        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1796        return retValue;
1797    }   //  joinString()

1799    /**
1800     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1801     *  collection.<br>
1802     *  <br>For an array, this method can be called like this:<pre><code>  String [] a = {"1", "2", "3"};
1803     *  maxContentLength( Arrays.asList( a ) );</code></pre>
1804     *
1805     *  @param  list    The strings.
1806     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1807     *      in the list are {@code null}.
1808     *
1809     *  @deprecated Use
1810     *      {@link #maxContentLength(CharSequence[])},
1811     *      {@link #maxContentLength(Collection)},
1812     *      or
1813     *      {@link #maxContentLength(Stream)}
1814     *      instead.
1815     */
1816    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
1817    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
1818    public static final int maxContentLength( final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> list )
1819    {
1820        var retValue = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
1821        int len;
1822        for( final var cs : requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ) )
1823        {
1824            len = nonNull( cs ) ? cs.length() : -1;
1825            if( len > retValue )
1826            {
1827                retValue = len;
1828            }
1829        }
1830
1831        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1832        return retValue;
1833    }   //  maxContentLength()
1834
1835    /**
1836     *  Determines the maximum length over all Strings provided in the given
1837     *  {@link Stream}.
1838     *
1839     *  @param  stream  The strings.
1840     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1841     *      in the given {@code stream} are {@code null}, and
1842     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1843     *      if the given {@code stream} is empty.
1844     *
1845     *  @since 0.0.5
1846     */
1847    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1848    public static final int maxContentLength( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> stream )
1849    {
1850        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( stream, "stream" )
1851            .mapToInt( s -> nonNull( s ) ? s.length() : -1 )
1852            .max()
1853            .orElse( Integer.MIN_VALUE );
1854
1855        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1856        return retValue;
1857    }   //  maxContentLength()
1858
1859    /**
1860     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1861     *  {@link Collection}.
1862     *
1863     *  @param  list    The strings.
1864     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1865     *      in the given {@code list} are {@code null}, and
1866     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1867     *      if the given {@code list} is empty.
1868     *
1869     *  @since 0.0.5
1870     */
1871    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1872    public static final int maxContentLength( final Collection<? extends CharSequence> list )
1873    {
1874        final var retValue = maxContentLength( requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).stream() );
1875
1876        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1877        return retValue;
1878    }   //  maxContentLength()
1879
1880    /**
1881     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1882     *  array.
1883     *
1884     *  @param  a   The strings.
1885     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1886     *      in the array are {@code null}, and
1887     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1888     *      if the given array has zero length.
1889     *
1890     *  @since 0.0.5
1891     */
1892    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1893    public static final int maxContentLength( final CharSequence... a )
1894    {
1895        final var retValue = maxContentLength( Arrays.stream( requireNonNullArgument( a, "a" ) ) );
1896
1897        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1898        return retValue;
1899    }   //  maxContentLength()

1901    /**
1902     *  <p>{@summary Normalizes the given String to a pure ASCII String.} This
1903     *  replaces 'Ã' by 'ss' and replaces all diacritical characters by their
1904     *  base form (that mean that 'Ã¼' gets 'u' and so on). For the normalizing
1905     *  of a search criteria, this should be sufficient, although it may cause
1906     *  issues for non-latin scripts, as for these the input can be mapped to
1907     *  the empty String.
1908     *
1909     *  @note   The scandinavian letters 'Ã¸' and 'Ã' are not diacritical
1910     *      letters, nevertheless they will be replaced.
1911     *
1912     *  @param  s   The input string.
1913     *  @return The normalised String, only containing ASCII characters; it
1914     *      could be empty.
1915     */
1916    public static final String normalizeToASCII( final CharSequence s )
1917    {
1918        final var input = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).toString()
1919            .replace( "Ã", "ss" )
1920            .replace( 'Ã¸', 'o' )
1921            .replace( 'Ã', 'O' );
1922        final var retValue = normalize( input, NFD )
1923            .replaceAll( "[^\\p{ASCII}]", EMPTY_STRING );
1924
1925        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1926        return retValue;
1927    }   //  normalizeToASCII()
1928
1929    /**
1930     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1931     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1932     *
1933     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1934     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1935     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1936     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1937     *  @param  mode    The
1938     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1939     *  @param  clip    {@code true} if the input string {@code s} should
1940     *      be cut in case it is longer than {@code length}, {@code false}
1941     *      if it has to be returned unchanged .
1942     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1943     *
1944     *  @since 0.0.5
1945     */
1946    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1947    public static final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final boolean clip )
1948    {
1949        return pad( s, length, c, mode, clip ? CLIPPING_CUT : CLIPPING_NONE );
1950    }   //  pad()
1951
1952    /**
1953     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1954     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1955     *
1956     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1957     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1958     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1959     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1960     *  @param  mode    The
1961     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1962     *  @param  clip    The
1963     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Clipping clipping mode}.
1964     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1965     *
1966     *  @since 0.0.5
1967     */
1968    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1969    public static final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final Clipping clip )
1970    {
1971        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression
1972        if( ((requireNonNullArgument( clip, "clip" ) == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE) && (length < 4)) || ((clip == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE) && (length < 5)) )
1973        {
1974            throw new ValidationException( format( "Length %d is too short for clipping mode %s", length, clip.toString() ) );
1975        }
1976        requireNonNullArgument( mode, "mode" );
1977
1978        final String retValue;
1979        final var currentLength = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).length();
1980
1981        if( (length > 0) && (length != currentLength) )
1982        {
1983            if( currentLength > length )
1984            {
1985                retValue = clip.clip( s, length );
1986            }
1987            else
1988            {
1989                final var padSize = length - currentLength;
1990                retValue = mode.pad( s, padSize, c );
1991            }
1992        }
1993        else
1994        {
1995            retValue = s.toString();
1996        }
1997
1998        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1999        return retValue;
2000    }   //  pad()
2001
2002    /**
2003     *  Fills up the given string to the given length by adding blanks on both
2004     *  sides; will abbreviate the string if it is longer than the given
2005     *  length. The minimum length is 5.<br>
2006     *  <br>This is a shortcut to a call to
2007     *  {@link #pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping) pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ) }.
2008     *
2009     *  @param  s   The string to format.
2010     *  @param  length  The desired length; minimum value is 5.
2011     *  @return The re-formatted string.
2012     *
2013     *  @see Padding#PADDING_CENTER
2014     *  @see Clipping#CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
2015     *
2016     *  @since 0.0.5
2017     */
2018    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2019    public static final String padCenter( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ); }
2020

2036     */
2037    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )

2059    /**
2060     *  <p>{@summary Surrounds the given String with double-quotes
2061     *  (&quot;, &amp;#34;).}</p>
2062     *  <p>When the double-quote is needed in a String constant, it has to be
2063     *  escaped with a backslash:</p>
2064     *  <pre><code>&quot;\&quot;â¦\&quot;&quot;</code></pre>
2065     *  <p>Sometimes, this is just ugly, and there this method comes into
2066     *  play.</p>
2067     *
2068     *  @param  s   The String to surround; can be {@code null}.
2069     *  @return The quoted String; will be {@code null} if the argument was
2070     *      {@code null} already.
2071     */
2072    public static final String quote( final CharSequence s )
2073    {
2074        final var retValue = isNull( s ) ? null : format( "\"%s\"u\"", s );
2075
2076        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2077        return retValue;
2078    }   //  quote()

2080    /**
2081     *  <p>{@summary This method replaces all diacritical characters in the
2082     *  input String by their base form.} That means that 'Ã¼' gets 'u', `Ã'
2083     *  gets 'E' and so on).</p>
2084     *  <p>This differs from
2085     *  {@link #normalizeToASCII(CharSequence)}
2086     *  as this method still allows non-ASCII characters in the output.</p>
2087     *
2088     *  @note   The scandinavian letters 'Ã¸' and 'Ã' are not diacritical
2089     *      letters, meaning they will not be replaced.
2090     *
2091     *  @param  s   The input string.
2092     *  @return The normalised String, not containing any diacritical
2093     *      characters.
2094     */
2095    public static final String removeDiacriticalMarks( final CharSequence s )
2096    {
2097        final var retValue = normalize( requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ), NFD )
2098            .replaceAll("\\p{InCombiningDiacriticalMarks}+", EMPTY_STRING );
2099
2100        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2101        return retValue;
2102    }   //  removeDiacriticalMarks()
